headline: Disney CEO Shift Puts Focus On Valuation And Future Growth Priorities
summary: Disney CEO Bob Iger is expected to step down before the end of his current contract. The Disney board is set to meet next week to vote on his successor, with attention on internal candidates. The decision is seen as a key leadership moment for Walt Disney, ticker NYSE:DIS, and its long term direction. For investors watching NYSE:DIS, the timing of this leadership change comes with the stock around $112.8 and a mixed return profile. The share price return over 3 years is 5.1%, while the 5...

headline: Disney is Close to Picking Parks Chief D’Amaro as Next CEO
summary: D’Amaro, 54, has led the unit that delivers most of Disney’s profits since 2020.  If approved, D’Amaro will succeed Bob Iger, who ran the world’s largest entertainment company from 2005 to 2020 and returned as CEO in 2022.  “The board has not yet selected the next CEO of the Walt Disney Co. and once that decision is made, we will announce it,” a Disney spokesperson said in an emailed statement.

content.title: Disney is Close to Picking Parks Chief D’Amaro as Next CEO
content.summary: D’Amaro, 54, has led the unit that delivers most of Disney’s profits since 2020.  If approved, D’Amaro will succeed Bob Iger, who ran the world’s largest entertainment company from 2005 to 2020 and returned as CEO in 2022.  “The board has not yet selected the next CEO of the Walt Disney Co. and once that decision is made, we will announce it,” a Disney spokesperson said in an emailed statement.

headline: Disney's first quarter is powered by box-office hits 'Zootopia 2' and 'Avatar: Fire and Ash'
summary: Disney posted a strong first quarter, powered by box-office hits “Zootopia 2” and “Avatar: Fire and Ash. The Walt Disney Co. earned $2.4 billion, or $1.34 per share, for the three months ended Dec. 27. It earned $2.64 billion, or $1.40 per share, a year ago.

content.title: Disney's first quarter is powered by box-office hits 'Zootopia 2' and 'Avatar: Fire and Ash'
content.summary: Disney posted a strong first quarter, powered by box-office hits “Zootopia 2” and “Avatar: Fire and Ash. The Walt Disney Co. earned $2.4 billion, or $1.34 per share, for the three months ended Dec. 27. It earned $2.64 billion, or $1.40 per share, a year ago.

headline: Disney’s (NYSE:DIS) Q4 CY2025 Sales Top Estimates
summary: Global entertainment and media company Disney (NYSE:DIS) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.2% year on year to $25.98 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.63 per share was 3.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Disney’s (NYSE:DIS) Q4 CY2025 Sales Top Estimates
content.summary: Global entertainment and media company Disney (NYSE:DIS) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.2% year on year to $25.98 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.63 per share was 3.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Palantir Earnings Arrive Just as Stock Could Use Some Good News
summary: Shares of the software company have tumbled 29% from their November peak, reached right before Palantir last reported results, and are down 18% to start 2026, putting them among the 15 worst performers in the S&P 500 this year.  While the selloff has cut into Palantir’s valuation, shares still trade for roughly 142 times expected earnings, the third-highest multiple in the S&P 500.

content.title: Palantir Earnings Arrive Just as Stock Could Use Some Good News
content.summary: Shares of the software company have tumbled 29% from their November peak, reached right before Palantir last reported results, and are down 18% to start 2026, putting them among the 15 worst performers in the S&P 500 this year.  While the selloff has cut into Palantir’s valuation, shares still trade for roughly 142 times expected earnings, the third-highest multiple in the S&P 500.

headline: Disney: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the Burbank, California-based company said it had profit of $1.34. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were $1.63 per share. The results topped Wall Street expectations.

content.title: Disney: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: On a per-share basis, the Burbank, California-based company said it had profit of $1.34. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were $1.63 per share. The results topped Wall Street expectations.

headline: Disney's theme park revenue soared, but a prolonged YouTube contract dispute dampened its Q1 earnings
summary: Walt Disney Co. saw record quarterly revenue for its theme parks division, but its Fubo deal and YouTube carriage dispute dragged down total segment operating income.
